Articles.Content:
True, true.

Hey, TJP said he was testing the mods, how are they working so far?

To prevent a total loss of crafts (I.e stealth), we should back up or crags, whether it be on Google Drive or on Dropbox, we really should.

I downloaded the mods last night and I'll be testing them out tonight. Joys of a half-day at school!

EDIT: If tests are all successful, I'll give you guys a common GameData folder.

Edited July 23, 2014 by TJPrime

I downloaded the mods last night and I'll be testing them out tonight. Joys of a half-day at school!

EDIT: If tests are all successful, I'll give you guys a common GameData folder.

for the .24???

i still got the original .23.5 gamedata folder zipped.

for the .24???

i still got the original .23.5 gamedata folder zipped.

Yes for .24, stealth eagle got a new computer and he can't go back to .23.5

Also, I have pm'd KvickFlygarn87, I am currently waiting for a reply.

EDIT: Kvic has wrote back, he's still in. Waiting on the go for mods, TJP.

Edited July 24, 2014 by Uberlyuber

I'll give a full list of mods that are compatible and ones that aren't later on today. At least in sandbox, that is. Testing for career mode will start when I've tested all the mods in sandbox.

Edited July 24, 2014 by TJPrime

Things do appear stable. This post will have a link to a download for the GameData folder once uploaded (it's gonna take ages )

A few things you need to know about the download:

- It will contain all folders with all mods and the stock parts. You need to replace the GameData folder itself.

- Upon start-up, it will say RSS and Firespitter are incompatible. I have found nothing wrong with the parts as of yet.

- On a personal note, I have never seen so many pages for parts.

LINK: (please wait... Loading...)

One extra thing - I haven't done so already, but if it is ok with everyone, may I add a planet system? It's sort of my thing

Edited July 24, 2014 by TJPrime
As far as I know, we aren't leaving Kerbal SOI so unless we go interplanetary, it won't be needed.

Things do appear stable. This post will have a link to a download for the GameData folder once uploaded (it's gonna take ages )

A few things you need to know about the download:

Thank God!

Alrighty tighty than, Dragon Army, please Check in on your next comment! Because we are finally starting!

Also, to keep in tune with a very important thing we humans/kerbals call the "law," we're going to have to dump p-wings unless I can get it's creators permission.

No, unless you can do so stock, you may not add your own planet system. Sorry TJP

Edited July 25, 2014 by Uberlyuber

Dragon Army here. I'll begin the turn either Saturday or Sunday. (I have plans for tonight already) I'll say when we have started and I'll have some footage up on youtube but first I need to do my K Prize entry and I can set up a drop box for all KSP War files if you want.
Alright. The GameData folder will begin it's upload to google drive tomorrow morning. It will take until about mid-day for it to complete, but until then, *pun warning* I'm TJPrime, don't fly safe!

Alright. The GameData folder will begin it's upload to google drive tomorrow morning. It will take until about mid-day for it to complete, but until then, -snip-

what GMT zone are you on?
Guys, we should settle on a WST (War standard time) to use for keeping track of time. I vote for PST.
I vote GMT or EST

I Vote I.S.S. Time!

Let's use the time they use on the I.S.S.

It would be fair, right?

I Vote I.S.S. Time!

Let's use the time they use on the I.S.S.

That's GMT, I believe.

Also, unfortunately, because of a number of factors (mainly because my parents logged me off), the GameData folder failed to upload. To add to unfortunatness (it's a word now, mother-kerbal!), I can't try to upload again until Saturday because I'll be away this week. Sorry, guys!

All right, the only flag I will change is orange team's flag, which is now the kerbal2 flag(Orange kerbal flag)

Also, DA, your turn is now!
